alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 8:48AM CDT until August 07 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN JO DAVIESS AND STEPHENSON COUNTIES... At 848 AM CDT, emergency management reported flash flooding over much of Stephenson County, with road washouts and water over roadways. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area through the morning, which could worsen the ongoing flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Freeport, Lena, Lake Leaquana State Park, McConnell, Buena Vista, Red Oak, Cedarville, Damacus, and Elerory. This includes the following streams and drainages... East Branch Richland Creek, Rush Creek, Kentucky Creek, Middle Fork Plum River, Spring Branch, Muddy Plum River, Pecatonica River, South Fork Apple River, East Plum River, Cedar Creek, Preston Creek, Morrison Spring Branch, Camp Creek, Coon Creek, Boone Branch, East Fork Creek, Indian Creek, Scrub Creek, Yellow Creek, Wolf Creek, Davis Creek, Brown Creek, Waddams Creek, Rindesbacher Creek, Lost Creek, Spafford Creek, Richland Creek, Apple River, Honey Creek, Spring Creek, Rock Run, Plum River, Pink Creek, Crane Grove Creek, Silver Creek, Mud Run, Lilly Branch, Muddy Creek, Sumner Creek, Clear Creek, Winneshiek Creek, Lawhorn Creek and Wickham Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
